if we have a single platform() entry in the whole build than we woudn't even need variables on a first place.

ah but you're talking about defining an ad-hoc platform? Vs importing a "platform" (in the "an existing Maven BOM" sense)... which Gradle documents as a regular dependency declaration in their docs:

The BOM support in Gradle works similar to using import when depending on a BOM in Maven. In Gradle however, it is done via a regular dependency declaration on the BOM:

Unfortunately Gradle only supports defining a platform in a module that cannot be also a java or java-library module, ie. one that is intended to be published). So no adhoc platform definition, and we're stuck with variables for now.
